definition:
*A variable network topology* is defined by an indexed family or class
of networks of one-dimensional $CW$-complexes $[CW_i]$ with $i \in I$ in
the category **Top** of topological spaces with additional homology (or
cohomology) axioms, rules, or properties of the underlying
$CW$-complexes, that specify the transformation maps as a sequence of
homotopoy maps.
